p: Third, and similar to the first point, the higher efficiency and lower cost of the secondary vaccination (sub-panels (a-ii), (c-ii), and (c-iv)) encouraged people to commit to receiving secondary vaccination ( Fig. 5(b)), which reduced the size of secondary infection ( Fig. 4(b)). Although the case of (a-iv) should be one of above those, it does not indicate a high fraction of secondary vaccination. The reason why this happens was what we already discussed in the previous paragraph.
